item.title: vibe coding probably is not coming for your dev job -- but the marketing department is screwed
item.description: Alternatively, I could have titled this blog post “how I tried to build an app with AI and really wish I hadn’t.” I don’t think I will ever work as a hands-on content marketer again. But at least I learned to code again; the one thing the arbiters of agentic coding AI promised me I wouldn’t have to.

item.title: behold the a(i)ppocalypse — ruminating on the death of the App Store
item.description:
Now, considering the sorry state of LLM1 benchmarks insofar as it concerns the probably only remotely reliable test for “generalized intelligence,” Humanity’s Last Exam, it is likely going to be a while before we have to contend with a globalized SkyNet coming to rapture us all to cyberspace.

There seems, however, to be unfolding the demise of an early victim. It squeaks like a canary in the coal mine — if you will — of where unrelenting human greed and increasing automation is likely to drive us all eventually. I am, of course, talking about The App Store.

item.title: you are probably overpaying for bad software
item.description:
You’re being milked, and it is only partially your own fault. Every “AI coding " app under the sun seems intent on making it as opaque and utterly confusing as possible to find out exactly what you’re paying, and what you’re even paying for. Worse still, the most expensive services seem to also be the worst, the least secure, and the ones with the most predatory lock-ins. But at least they have ✨aesthetics✨, I guess.
